The Plague Rats are a perfect tool in the unfathomable plan of shapeless evil, spreading disease and death through the population like wild fire, lurking in the shadows ready to pounce on the weak or vulnerable.

Blister contains three models, three 30mm bases and one full colour profile card.

Name: Phrasell
Description:
Invent amusing little phrases; reverse-initialisations.

The judge picks a topic, flips over 2 more cards (for 4 letters) and everyone else races to come up with a 4-word phrase, using those 4 letters as initials.

The inventors of the best phrases (as chosen by the judge) are rewarded and the winner becomes the next judge.

This is one of many games playable with the Wibbell++ deck.

Name: 3rd Edict
Description:
Two worlds collide as the magically rich Taethys collides with the technology driven Valkja.  Utilize state of the art technology and powerful spells to establish dominance over all who oppose you.  3rd Edict is designed for 3-6 players and takes around 30-60 minutes per game. Players draw from a central deck and use unique abilities to shape their play style.

Throw a fireball to Scorch your enemies or Redirect and turn their attacks back on them.  Take what you desire with Pickpocket.  Barrier protects a player from all sources, including themselves.  Equipment like Drone Guardian forces your opponents to deal with it before they can attack you.  The Bag of Many Things means you will have more options than everyone else.

With eight game types, players will find a battle that works for them.  In First Blood the first player to get a kill wins the game, just make sure you don't overextend.  Recruitment has you destroy each other but instead of being eliminated that player joins your team instead.  Secret Win Conditions is just that.  Each player draws a mission at random and whoever completes it first wins.

Name: RUMBLESLAM: Vitamir
Description:
"Built to endure the sub-zero temperatures of his homeland, Vitamir is clad in thick hair that acts as both insulator and armor. During his travels, the bear-like wrestler created dozens of folk stories and rumors. The Sasquatch? Just Vitamir taking a stroll through the woods. The abominable snowman? Just Vitamir lost in a snowstorm."

Fan favorite Vitamir is a force unto himself. A giant of a man, he has some of the best movement and action points of any WEIGHT 3 wrestler. He's got great stats and high damaging special abilities. His Man Against Wild ability does extra damage when targeting Feral Den or Forest Soul wrestlers, which makes him the perfect Kaiser's Palace wrestler to add a little extra oomph to a Heavy Pounders team.

Name: Chasing Eden (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
Description:
Chasing Eden is a custom scenario for the Time Stories boardgame.

"Times were very different before The Great Peace and the founding of The Time Agency. A powerful government hierarchy wrestled with outlaws and criminal gangs that refused to be quashed. The law was unrelenting and the streets were heavily policed."

Will your team survive this cyberpunk adventure? Chasing Eden is driven by its simple storytelling and evocative artwork set during the founding of the Time Agency. Good luck solving this mystery, and please send through any feedback you might have!

EDIT: Thanks to all who have played the game and left their feedback!

For those interested, I should have given some greater detail in the original upload. A large part of the inspiration was the movie "Edge of Tomorrow", where the character is forced to repeat the same day (learning something new each time) until he finds the path forward. Admittedly, when I've played other Time Stories scenarios my aim has always been to finish while hopefully not having to repeat the mission, but that is largely because Bob is so cranky :P

I wanted my story to have things that you need to pay attention to on the first run (e.g. how to make money, how to save/gain time, how to become badass enough to win the boss-fight, and what receptacle characters are integral to the story). And for the keen of eye, there are various clues around for the various "vital" decisions. The scenario only has a couple of smaller "puzzles" - the greatest puzzle I wanted to make was the actual progression of the story!

Name: Search & Destroy
Description:
A multi-player card game for librarians and teachers that teaches database search skills while students compete to stay alive.

In Search & Destroy, every player starts with 4 cards from the Play Deck. On a turn, the player first draws 2 Keyword Cards and lays one down. They may then play up to 1 Action or Mod card, which may effect themselves or another player.  Next, the player searches the terms on their played card(s) in a library database. Finally they draw from the play deck to maintain 4 cards in their hand. Play then moves counter-clockwise.  Players are eliminated if their database search yields no results. The last player remaining wins!

Box Components:
64 Keyword Cards
41 Mod & Action Cards (the Play Deck)
6 Rule Cards
4 blank Keyword Cards
Rulebook

Search & Destroy teaches the following skills:
search string design
keyword selection
basic boolean searching
faceting
peer-review
friendly competition

Name: Jack and Jill
Description:
'Jack and Jill' was published in 1890 by the Milton Bradley Company of Springfield, Massachusetts.

Based on the theme on the nursery rhyme, the object of this card game is to earn 100 points by helping Jack and Jill up the hill without tumbling down. The 21 card deck is complete and includes:

4 Jack and Jill cards numbered 1 to 4;
    1 image of Jack and Jill tumbling down the hill;
    1 pail card;
    14 number cards from 1 to nine points; 
    An instruction card.
